Description: Rim fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery bowl; slipped on exterior. Inside glazed with a reserved band and an added white band at lower break. On the outside, a griffin to left, its forepart preserved; large incised rosette and smaller unincised fillers in the field; added red on the neck and one wing feather of the griffin, and for occasional petals of the rosette.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 23, no. 75 pl. 21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.145)
